hint.text:
Pythagorean triplets can be expressed in general form as \(2m, (m^2-1) and (m^2+1)\)
In a Pythagorean triplet, \((2m)^2+(m^2-1)^2=(m^2+1)^2\)

solution.text:
The middle member of the Pythagorean triplet is \(_{j}_\)
Let's take \((m^2-1)=_{j}_\)
Therefore, \(m=\sqrt{_{{j+1}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow m=_{{(j+1)**(Decimal(str(0.5)))}}_\)
The other members \(2m\) and \((m^2+1)\) are \(_{{2*((j+1)**(Decimal(str(0.5))))}}_\) and \(_{{j+1+1}}_\) respectively.
